RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 19000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 23 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 23 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price$ 12,500, For Each $1,250 To $10,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FREESTYLE stalked the contested early -ace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, set sail two wide in pursuit of KOALA entering the final turn, overtook that rival midway through the turn and opened up a clear advantage entering the lane, and was never seriously threatened late. DREAMB settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced her bid from along the inside entering the final turn, shifted off the rail midway through the turn, and closed determinedly one out from the rail in the drive to prove clearly second best. NO PEOPLE unhurried early and trailed the field into the backstretch while racing out from the rail, launched her bid four wide entering the final turn, and improved her position three out from the rail in the drive to get up for a share. KOALA away alertly and vied for the lead from the inside of REA MEA entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backside, shook clear of her pace rival approaching the final turn, was quickly overtaken by FREESTYLE midway through the turn, and faded in the lane. REA MEA broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of KOALA entering the first turn, chased that rival in the run down the backstretch, began to lose touch with her pace rival entering the final turn, and had little to offer late, while having to steady slightly nearing the wire.

ENTRY.NAME: No People
ENTRY.OWNER: Bulldog Bros Racing and LeMasurier Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Koala
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, led, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Rea Mea
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Dreamb
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Freestyle
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 23 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 23 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JOCK TALK stalked the leaders from the back of the pack while racing three wide entering the stretch the first time, continued with a three wide trip from a stalking trip in the run down the backside, rallied four wide entering the final turn, and closed with a rush three out from the rail in deep stretch to get up in time. THERE GOES MY HERO broke sharply and raced to the lead one out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, battled down the backstretch from the outside of of DONE THAT, continued their battle through the final turn and into the stretch, but was unable to fend off the late surge by JOCK TALK in the closing strides. DONE THAT away well and tracked the pacesetter from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, continued to save ground through the second turn, engaged the leader from along the inside midway down the backside, continued to battle with THERE GOES MY HERO through the final turn and into the lane, and just missed the place while finishing two wide. KLIMTOGLORY away alertly and tracked the leader into the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, forced the pace three wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but lacked the closing response needed when called upon. SILVER ARROW stalked the leaders while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, dropped back to trail entering the second turn, commenced her bid from along the rail entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: There Goes My Hero
ENTRY.OWNER: Klimes Helen McDonald Jo-Anne and Pring Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led inside, dueled 3w, rallied 3w, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Klimtoglory
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 w, pressed 3w, rallied 3w, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Done That
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, vied 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Arrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied rail, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Jock Talk
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3w, rallied 4w, closed 4w, up in time

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 3 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 18000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, For Each $2,500 To $45,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $62,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAKBURNER rushed up to assume command approaching the turn while racing one out from the rail, opened a clear advantage through the final turn, and was never seriously threatened late. SHOCK THE HOUSE chased the leader into the turn while racing one out from the rail, and finished willingly two wide in the drive while gaining ground late while laying in slightly in the closing strides. SAILINGFORTHESTARS away alertly and chased the leader into the turn while saving ground at the rail, was never a threat to the winner but battled gamely from along the rail in the drive to garner a share in a solid debut. DREAMING D'ORO away well, while drifting out in the opening strides, chased the pacesetter three wide through the turn, and battled gamely two out from the rail in the drive while unable to gain ground late. The rider of DREAMING D'ORO lost his crop at the head of the lane. FOOTHILLS BLVD. broke sharply, but was devoid of early speed while saving ground along the inside, and failed to make a late impact. KIKIS LOVE OF LIFE chased two wide into the turn from the back of the pack, and failed to make a late impact while racing one out from the rail in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Kikis Love of Life
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2 wide, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Foothills Blvd.
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, chased inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Sailingforthestars
ENTRY.OWNER: Wil - A - Way Farm Jewsbury Gail C and Jarvis Pat
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, chased rail, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Shock the House
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bakburner
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: led 2 wide, held

ENTRY.NAME: Dreaming d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, chased 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BECKETT'S BEST away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside, maintained his advantage into the lane, and increased that margin late under confident handling. SHE'S KIND OF HOT broke sharply and stalked the leader from along the rail entering the backstretch, continued to save ground while mounting her bid at the rail through the final turn, and closed determinedly from just off the rail in the drive to prove second best. OUR BLOKE was off a step slow, and settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished smartly three wide in the drive to get up for a share. RICK'S DANCER away well and tracked the pacesetter two wide into the backstretch, commenced his bid one out from the rail entering the final turn, but was outfinished late while racing at the rail. ON MY GOOD SIDE broke inwards in the opening strides and trailed the field into the backstretch, saved ground through the final turn, but was never a factor. MR MORRIS was off a step slow, but pulled his way into a stalking trip two out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Beckett's Best
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: On My Good Side
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke inwards, trailed, rallied inside, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Morris
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, stalked 3 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: She's Kind of Hot
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked inside, rallied rail, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Our Bloke
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Rick's Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACE'S SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 23 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 23 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JERSEY LILLIE broke sharply and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly two out from the rail through the final turn, split rivals in mid stretch and inched clear late. PINEAPPLE TIDBITS stalked the early pace while racing two wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied one out from the rail entering the final turn, and closed willingly four wide in the drive to get up for the place. ROSE OF TEXAS away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and through the final turn, continued to battle for the lead into the lane, and gave way grudgingly late while finishing on even terms with HARLAN'S ANGEL for a share. HARLAN'S ANGEL tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, launched her bid four wide entering the final turn, and closed five wide in the drive to finish on even terms with ROSE OF TEXAS. ANOTHERSUNNYDAY rushed up to duel for the lead from the outside of ROSE OF TEXAS entering he first turn, battled in the run down the backside and through the final turn while continuing to force the issue, but was outfinished late while racing one out from the rail in the drive. RACINO stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, commenced her bid from along the inside entering the final turn while awaiting room, but needed more in the late stages. CERTIFIABLE unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, was always well back and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Racino
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Certifiable
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Pineapple Tidbits
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Rose of Texas
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Jersey Lillie
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Ed Wright Cattle Co. Inc. & MilesChilders

ENTRY.NAME: Anothersunnyday
ENTRY.OWNER: Leffler Bob Killins Bryan and McCormick Gord
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Harlan's Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 5 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Purse 25000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 24 Allowed 4 lbs. (Maiden, Claiming, And Starter Races Not Considered For Allowances) (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $25,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BOLD ARCH away well and raced to an uncontested lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, controlled the pace through the second turn and in the run down the backstretch, maintained a clear lead through the final turn, but was all out to fend off JUST JIMMY late to prevail. JUST JIMMY away alertly and eased off the lead to assume a tracking trip entering the stretch the first time, maintained his position in the run down the backside and into the final turn, drifted in slightly while the rider appeared to have difficulties pulling his stick into his right hand, then surged late under right handed encouragement to just miss. STORMY BLUE broke sharply and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, held his position in the run down the backside, rallied from along the rail through the final turn, and finished willingly from along the inside in the drive in an even effort. BOITANO settled off the early pace while saving ground along the inside entering the lane the first time, pulled his way closer in the run down the backstretch, rallied from along the inside through the final turn, and closed one out from the rail in the drive. PAY MY WAY unhurried early while dropping back to trail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon. SET TO SHINE stalked the dueling leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, held his position in the run down the backstretch, began to struggle while racing three wide entering the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Pay My Way
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Set to Shine
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Stormy Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail, evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Boitano
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E Danard Don B and Rozenek Conrad
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied rail, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bold Arch
ENTRY.OWNER: Morrison, John and Kim and Sadler, Robin
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, clear lead, held

ENTRY.NAME: Just Jimmy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 w, rallied 2 w, closed 2w, just missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 23 Allowed 2 lbs. A Rac e Since July 23 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AMANDA tracked the pacesetter into the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, dropped into a stalking trip in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly from along the inside through the final turn, tipped three wide for the drive and closed determinedly to be up in time. ANIMA stalked the pacesetter into the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, rushed up to force the issue two wide entering the second turn, continued to force the issue from the outside of BAKFIRE BABY in the run down the backside and through the final turn, disposed of her pace rival in mid stretch, but was unable to hold off the late charge by AMANDA in the closing strides. MISS THE HYPE settled off the early pace while racing three wide through the stretch the first time, began to advance midway down the backside to gain a striking position, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, shifted four wide in mid stretch and closed with a rush to just miss the place. BAKZONE tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, dropped back to trail in the run down the backstretch, rallied one out from the rail entering the final turn, and improved her position while finishing three wide in the drive. BAKFIRE BABY away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, battled for the lead from the inside of ANIMA in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, was unable to match strides with her pace rival entering the lane, and weakened late. FILLY FATALE broke sharply and stalked the pacesetter through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, tracked the dueling leaders in the run down the backside and into the final turn, but faded in the late going. TEXAS HUMOR trailed the field into the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, bided her time towards the back of the pack in the run down the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but was outfinished over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Bakfire Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Amanda
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, rallied rail, closed 3 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Anima
ENTRY.OWNER: Bulldog Bros Racing and LeMasurier Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2w, rallied 2 wide, led, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Bakzone
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Miss the Hype
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, advanced 3/8, rallied rail, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Filly Fatale
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing No Trump Stable Bill Breen Racing and Elder Matt
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Humor
ENTRY.OWNER: GO Stables and Ramirez Alexa Danae
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied 3 wide, outfinished
